intro: Hieracium umbellatum subsp. linariifolium, commonly known as the slender wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
